TypeSignature.Value: Public Interface GestureDetector.IOnGestureListener Implements IDisposable, IJavaObject, IJavaPeerable
public: interface class GestureDetector::IOnGestureListener : Android::Runtime::IJavaObject, IDisposable, Java::Interop::IJavaPeerable
public interface GestureDetector.IOnGestureListener : Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, IDisposable, Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable

.class nested public interface auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit GestureDetector/IOnGestureListener implements class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Interop.IJavaPeerable, class System.IDisposable
type GestureDetector.IOnGestureListener = interface interface IJavaObject interface IDisposable interface IJavaPeerable

Docs.summary: The listener that is used to notify when gestures occur.

remarks.para: The listener that is used to notify when gestures occur. If you want to listen for all the different gestures then implement this interface. If you only want to listen for a subset it might be easier to extend SimpleOnGestureListener.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function OnDown (e As MotionEvent) As Boolean
public: bool OnDown(Android::Views::MotionEvent ^ e);
public bool OnDown (Android.Views.MotionEvent e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnDown(class Android.Views.MotionEvent e) cil managed
abstract member OnDown : Android.Views.MotionEvent -> bool

Docs.summary: Notified when a tap occurs with the down MotionEvent that triggered it.

remarks.para: Notified when a tap occurs with the down MotionEvent that triggered it. This will be triggered immediately for every down event. All other events should be preceded by this.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function OnFling (e1 As MotionEvent, e2 As MotionEvent, velocityX As Single, velocityY As Single) As Boolean
public: bool OnFling(Android::Views::MotionEvent ^ e1, Android::Views::MotionEvent ^ e2, float velocityX, float velocityY);
public bool OnFling (Android.Views.MotionEvent? e1, Android.Views.MotionEvent e2, float velocityX, float velocityY);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnFling(class Android.Views.MotionEvent e1, class Android.Views.MotionEvent e2, float32 velocityX, float32 velocityY) cil managed
abstract member OnFling : Android.Views.MotionEvent * Android.Views.MotionEvent * single * single -> bool

Docs.param: The first down motion event that started the fling. A null event indicates an incomplete event stream or error state.
The move motion event that triggered the current onFling.
The velocity of this fling measured in pixels per second along the x axis.
The velocity of this fling measured in pixels per second along the y axis.
Docs.summary: Notified of a fling event when it occurs with the initial on down MotionEvent and the matching up MotionEvent.
Docs.returns: true if the event is consumed, else false

remarks.para: Notified of a fling event when it occurs with the initial on down MotionEvent and the matching up MotionEvent. The calculated velocity is supplied along the x and y axis in pixels per second.

format.a: Java documentation for android.view.GestureDetector.OnGestureListener.onFling(android.view.MotionEvent, android.view.MotionEvent, float, float).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Notified when a long press occurs with the initial on down MotionEvent that trigged it.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Function OnScroll (e1 As MotionEvent, e2 As MotionEvent, distanceX As Single, distanceY As Single) As Boolean
public: bool OnScroll(Android::Views::MotionEvent ^ e1, Android::Views::MotionEvent ^ e2, float distanceX, float distanceY);
public bool OnScroll (Android.Views.MotionEvent? e1, Android.Views.MotionEvent e2, float distanceX, float distanceY);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool OnScroll(class Android.Views.MotionEvent e1, class Android.Views.MotionEvent e2, float32 distanceX, float32 distanceY) cil managed
abstract member OnScroll : Android.Views.MotionEvent * Android.Views.MotionEvent * single * single -> bool

Docs.param: The first down motion event that started the scrolling. A null event indicates an incomplete event stream or error state.
The move motion event that triggered the current onScroll.
The distance along the X axis that has been scrolled since the last call to onScroll. This is NOT the distance between e1 and e2.
The distance along the Y axis that has been scrolled since the last call to onScroll. This is NOT the distance between e1 and e2.
Docs.summary: Notified when a scroll occurs with the initial on down MotionEvent and the current move MotionEvent.
Docs.returns: true if the event is consumed, else false

remarks.para: Notified when a scroll occurs with the initial on down MotionEvent and the current move MotionEvent. The distance in x and y is also supplied for convenience.

format.a: Java documentation for android.view.GestureDetector.OnGestureListener.onScroll(android.view.MotionEvent, android.view.MotionEvent, float, float).

Docs.summary: The user has performed a down MotionEvent and not performed a move or up yet.

remarks.para: The user has performed a down MotionEvent and not performed a move or up yet. This event is commonly used to provide visual feedback to the user to let them know that their action has been recognized i.e. highlight an element.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
